dbms.parser
Class SQLParser

java.lang.Object
  dbms.parser.SQLParser

public class SQLParser
extends Object

This class implements a Parser for SQL-92.It doesn't yet support the "not equal" operator as well as the '(' & ')' that alter the priority of the operations.

Version:
0.95

Method Detail

parseCommands

public void parseCommands(String BatchofCommands)
The parseCommands method finds the next command and calls the parse method to parse the command.

Parameters:
BatchofCommands - The String which forms the commands issued by the user or the automated batch of commands when these are entered from a file.

getNextLexicalUnit

private String getNextLexicalUnit()
This method determines the next lexical unit from the currentCommand it tries to match it with one of the SQLReserved or SQLPatterns our system recognises.

Returns:
The String of the lexicalUnit.
See Also:
SQLPatterns

recognizeLexicalUnit

private SQLTokens recognizeLexicalUnit(String lexicalUnit)
This method matches the lexicalUnit it takes as a parameter with an SQL token this DBMS recognises. If it cannot be matched with anyone of these tokens it labels the lexical unit as unknown.

Parameters:
lexicalUnit - The String to be recognised.
Returns:
SQLTokens The token that was recognized.

parseCreateTable

private void parseCreateTable()
If a create table query has been recognised from the parse method, parseCreateTable method checks if it is correct and then makes the ExececutionMachine to execute it. If it is not in a valid format, it returns a message that marks the error found and continues with the next query.

parseCreateIndex

private void parseCreateIndex()
If a create index query has been recognised from the parse method, the parseCreateIndex method checks if it is correct and then makes the ExececutionMachine to execute it. If it is not in a valid format, it returns a message that marks the error found and continues with the next query.

parseSelect

private void parseSelect()
If a select query has been recognised from the parse method, parseSelect method checks if it is correct and then makes the ExececutionMachine to execute it. If it is not in a valid format, it returns a message that marks the error found and continues with the next query.

parseInsertInto

private void parseInsertInto()
If an insert query has been recognised from the parse method, parseInsertInto method checks if it is correct and then makes the ExececutionMachine to execute it. If it is not in a valid format, it returns a message that marks the error found and continues with the next query.

parseDeleteFrom

private void parseDeleteFrom()
If a delete query has been recognised from the parse method, parseDeleteFrom method checks if it is correct and then makes the ExececutionMachine to execute it. If it is not in a valid format, it returns a message that marks the error found and continues with the next query.

parseDropIndex

private void parseDropIndex()
If a drop index query has been recognised from the parse method, parseDropIndex method checks if it is correct and then makes the ExececutionMachine to execute it. If it is not in a valid format, it returns a message that marks the error found and continues with the next query.

parse

private void parse()
The parse method tries to match the command that was given to her with one of the commands that our DBMS system supports. If it succeed then it calls the appropriate to check if the whole statement has the appropriate format. If the query has commands that are not supported it produces an appropriate message to the user.

printError

private void printError(String expected,
                        String found)
Returns a message to the user if another lexical unit's type appear where something else was expected.

Parameters:
expected - The String representation of the expected lexicalUnit.
found - The String that was found.
